p: Oviposition preference experiments were performed in the greenhouse (27 ± 3 °C; 60 ± 5% RH and 14L:10D) using 12 wooden cages (100 × 100 × 80 cm) covered in netting. One plant of each species was randomly placed in a circle within each cage. Fifty pairs of adult T. absoluta (50 two-day-old males and 50 females) were released into each cage and provided with a honey solution (10%) as a food source. Twenty-four hours later the adults were removed and the number of eggs laid on each plant species was counted. Each cage was considered as one replicate. In this experiment 1200 T. absoluta adults (600 females and 600 males) and 12 plants of each species were used.
